item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 29, 2025 at 12:35 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Gurus of 90s Web Design: Zeldman, Siegel, Nielsen (135 points | 49 comments)
2. My website is ugly because I made it (68 points | 14 comments)
3. Show HN: Typed-FFmpeg 3.0–Typed Interface to FFmpeg and Visual Filter Editor (222 points | 16 comments)
4. Edamagit: Magit for VSCode (66 points | 28 comments)

7. Simple programming language with offline usable browser IDE (7 points | discuss)
8. Show HN: Porting Terraria and Celeste to WebAssembly (247 points | 34 comments)
9. They used Xenon to climb Everest in days – is it the future of mountaineering? (47 points | 84 comments)
10. Long live American Science and Surplus (309 points | 82 comments)
11. Run a C# file directly using dotnet run app.cs (143 points | 105 comments)
12. High-quality OLED displays now enabling integrated thin and multichannel audio (62 points | 41 comments)
13. Show HN: I rewrote my Mac Electron app in Rust (545 points | 397 comments)
14. A toy RTOS inside Super Mario Bros. using emulator save states (216 points | 48 comments)
15. Japan Post launches 'digital address' system (357 points | 244 comments)
16. Chimps strike stones against trees as communication, study suggests (55 points | 10 comments)
17. RSyncUI – A SwiftUI based macOS GUI for rsync (39 points | 8 comments)
18. Compiler Explorer and the promise of URLs that last forever (310 points | 145 comments)
19. HTAP is Dead (125 points | 60 comments)
20. What programmers should know about how CPUs work [video] (26 points | 1 comment)
21. Google is using AI to censor independent websites like mine (99 points | 66 comments)
22. What If We Had Bigger Brains? Imagining Minds Beyond Ours (153 points | 182 comments)
23. Visualize and debug Rust programs with a new lens (190 points | 25 comments)
24. Can Open Source Projects Exit Foundations? (38 points | 33 comments)
25. I taught my 3-year-old to read like a 9-year-old (6 points | discuss)
26. What does “Undecidable” mean, anyway (117 points | 114 comments)
27. Compiling a neural net to C for a speedup (256 points | 82 comments)
28. Show HN: Tesseral – Open-Source Auth (176 points | 59 comments)
29. Apollo Lunar Surface Journal (31 points | 6 comments)
30. Data Breach at LexisNexis Risk Solutions (22 points | 3 comments)
